poem:
**An Honest Pace**

In the cool morning light of negotiations,  
Rachel Reeves holds the reins of time—  
a steady hand amidst the American rush,  
whispering to the pages of a contract,  
"We will not trip over expectation,"  
her words poised like a bookmark  
between one future and the next,  
settling softly as a breath.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Rachel Reeves dashes hopes of early breakthrough in UK-US trade deal Rachel Reeves has dashed hopes of an early breakthrough in trade talks with the Trump administration, stressing that the UK is “not going to rush” into a deal. Speaking before her first face-to-face meeting with the US Treasury secretary, Scott Bessent, in which she was expected to lobby him to reduce tariffs, the chancellor said negotiations would take time. “We’re not going to rush". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
